feed.title: My Essential Life - My Essential Life Blog

entry.title: Amazing Cure for Floaters
entry.content:
I was looking through some resources for essential oils and came across oils to use for "Floaters".  My mom had just mentioned she had one the day before!! I had no idea what a floater was before mom mentioned it.  A floater is a little black spot that "floats" around obstructing your vision.  My mom had gone to the optometrist and was told there was nothing they could do, so of course when I came across an essential oil recipe I asked my mom to just try it.  What did she have to lose on something that had no cure??!!! 

The recipe is simple - a drop of Lavender and a drop of Frankincense and dab it on the bones around the eye.  Mom did this 5-6 times per day.  She was amazed that she noticed some of the spots had disappeared after only a week!! So AWESOME!!!  

I love it when I find a new way to use essential oils.  There is so much to know so I love the Modern Essentials resource book.  Then I have so much information right at the tip of my fingers!  After all, I cant possible remember it all!  

We would love to hear from you, contact us any time!!  Don't forget to check out our store to find some amazing essential oil stuff!

entry.title: Essential Oil Skin Care Guide
entry.content:
So many skin types, so many essential oils... what oils do I use for my skin?

Essential Oils can be added to your skin care routine. But with all the different kinds of essential oils how are you supposed to know which oils to use for your skin type? Here is a list of different skin types and which oils work best.

       Essential Oils For Different Skin Types

Normal

 Not to oily and not to dry. Normal skin has few in any imperfections, no severe sensitivity, barely visible pores and radiant complexion. Add these oils to your facial routine. (I add them to my moisturizing cream)    

                        

  • Geranium Essential Oil
  • Lavender Essential Oil
  • Ylang Ylang Essential Oil
  • Immortelle (doTERRA anti-aging blend)

 

Dry

Dry skin may have almost invisible pores, dull rough complexion, red patches, more visible lines and has less elasticity. Smooth on a rich moisturizer after bathing and any of the following essential oils.

  • Sandalwood Essential Oil
  • Myrrh Essential Oil
  • Patchouli Essential Oil
  • Geranium Essential Oil
  • Lavender Essential Oil
  • Cedarwood Essential Oil

 

Oily

Oily skin may have enlarged pores, dull or shiny thick complexion, blackheads pimples and other blemishes may be present. Any of these oils can be added to your daily routine.

  • Lemon Essential Oil
  • Cypress Essential Oil
  • Frankincense Essential Oil
  • Geranium Essential Oil
  • Lemongrass Essential Oil
  • Wild Orange Essential Oil
  • Tea Tree Essential Oil

 

Sensitive

Sensitive skin can show up as redness, dryness, burning skin or itchy skin. There are many possible reasons, but most often it's in response to skin care products. Essential oils for sensitive skin are as follows.

  • Roman Chamomile Essential Oil
  • Lavender Essential Oil
  • Geranium Essential Oil

 

Mature

Mature skin can appear drier, lack tone and firmness, deep wrinkles are present, age spots appear, be dehydrated and can have open pores. Many essential oils can be effective in counteracting some of these qualities.

  • Myrrh Essential Oil
  • Frankincense Essential Oil
  • Ylang Ylang Essential Oil
  • Geranium Essential Oil
  • Helichrysum Essential Oil
  • Sandalwood Essential Oil
  • Wild Orange Essential Oil
  • Patchouli Essential Oil
  • Immortale (anti-aging blend)

 

Blemished

Blemished skin may appear to have dark marks or skin discoloration left behind due to acne whiteheads blackheads or pimples. Use these essential oils with your daily routine to lessen there appearance.

  • Tea Tree Essential Oil
  • Frankincense Essential Oil
  • Cedarwood Essential Oil
  • Helichyrsum Essential Oil
  • Lavender Essential Oil
  • Lemongrass Essential Oil
  • Patchouli Essential Oil
  • Immortale (anti-aging blend)

No matter which skin type you have, follow these steps to keep it looking its best.

  1. Avoid sitting in the sun for long periods of time.
  2. Use a sunscreen that blocks both UVA and UVB.
  3. Stay hydrated! Your skin will love you for drinking lots of water.
  4. Don't smoke.
  5. Wash your skin gently but thoroughly daily.
  6. Never wear makeup to bed.
  7. Add essential oils to your moisturizer to keep it looking fresh and young. 

 

Read more about essential oils and skin care in our Modern Essentials Reference Book or our Mini Modern Essentials Book is the perfect size to take with you on the go.

If you are looking for great quality essential oils shop here.

entry.title: We Are All Mom Enough
entry.content:
I Am Mom Enough

I am MOM enough to breastfeed

I am MOM enough to bottle feed

I am MOM enough to co-sleep

I am MOM enough to crib sleep

I am MOM enough to make my own babyfood

I am MOM enough to buy my babyfood

I am MOM enough to use cloth diapers

I am MOM enough to use disposable diapers

I am MOM enough to wear my baby

I am MOM enough to use a stroller

I am MOM enough to stay home

I am MOM enough to go to work

I am MOM enough to do both

I am MOM enough to choose what is best for my family

I am MOM enough to raise my children to be HAPPY and HEALTHY

Ok ladies, lets take these words to heart this year and every year. I know I have been consumed by what I believe others expectations of me are, but no more. My mom has to remind me of this sometimes when I let things get too big.  It is time I honour myself and all other MOMS who are all doing their best and that is the best! Let go of that superwoman cape that keeps feeling like a noose and just be you...you are all you need to be! That is all your kids have ever needed!

Sending our love on Mothers Day... Prairie Girls  

Want to check out our store? Find us HERE

entry.title: Relieve Stomach Upset In One Easy Step
entry.content:
Holiday weekends can wreak havoc on the digestive system and Easter is no exception!  This year we are traveling to see some family.  That will mean major overindulgence! 

First off, we are going to have 5 hours in our car, and that will most certainly mean car sickness for one or more of us.  My family will be very gracious hosts meaning all kinds of rich and delicious foods. Not to mention a glass or two of wine! To top off the weekend we will have a visit from the Easter Bunny, which I can only assume will mean loads of chocolate and candies for the kids....maybe, just maybe they will share with us! 

To sum up how this weekend will go....we will have a ton of fun and laughs....and most certainly a ton of tummy troubles!! 

Digestzen is our “go to” for any stomach troubles.  It contains Ginger, Fennel, Coriander, Tarragon, Anise, Caraway and Peppermint essential oils.  Combined together these oils ease stomach discomfort and aid in digestion and reduce gas and bloating. The perfect combination to help you through any tummy troubles!

This is an essential oil that comes with us everywhere!  We cannot live without it! I am always amazed at how fast it works, one or two drops is all it takes.  My husband and I take it internally, but the kids are not fans of the fennel taste so we dilute it with coconut oil in a roller bottle and rub it on their bellies.

 I also love love love peppermint. We use a combo of oils, Peppermint beadlets and Digestzen softgels.

We would love to hook you up with some awesome oils.  You can shop here for them.  Need some roller bottles for easy on the go application for the kids?  Find everything you need here.

entry.title: Stink Be Gone! Quick and Easy for the Busy Mom on the Go
entry.content:
“Moooooommm, I’m thirsty!!!”, the kids echo from the backseat right on cue!  Of course we are on the way to dance, and only 20 minutes away, but those little tummies in the back can’t possibly wait that long!

In true mom fashion, I have a cooler full of healthy snacks and drinks ready to pass back. I grab a bottle of milk and unscrew the lid just a little to help out the little hands waiting impatiently for the drink in the back seat.  Just as I pass it back, I hit a tiny pothole in the highway and lose grip on the bottle....milk splashes all down the seat and into the floor mat! We all know that is going to smell like rotten baby puke before I get a chance to mop it all up! 

Good thing I have my car diffuser attached to the vent...uggg ...I’m going to have to add a couple more drops of balance to ease my nerves to make it the rest of the way to dance, and get my mind off the nasty mess waiting for me when I get there!    

We just added some awesome car diffusers to our product list. Not only are they practical they are pretty too! We have three tree of life styles to choose from.  Amidst all the chaos in the backseat you can gaze down and take a deep breath to take in the beauty and aroma. They are super simple to use too, simply pop open the top and drop the oils on the felt pad, close it up and attach it to a vent.

So ladies and gentlemen, we have your back, another simple way to ease some of the stress of your day! 

We would love to hook you up with some of these sweet diffusers.  Just click HERE and we would also love love love to hear from you!! Contact us anytime!!

Erin and Angela

entry.title: Sick No More!
entry.content:
Tired of being sick??  I know I sure am!  I'm so done with snotty noses and belly aches. Between myself, my husband and our kids, someone has been battling some bug for weeks!  I’m very certain my boss would love it if I was actually at work a full week too!

We use Doterra oils at our house and there are a couple blends already prepared that I could NEVER live without – On Guard for immune support and Zengest for stomach issues. 

I found a couple of awesome roller blends to use for anyone who wants to mix up their own blends.

For Tummy Troubles try this Belly Blend

Try it in a sample size 5ml bottle.  Simply add 2 drops Coriander, 5 drops Fennel, 5 drops Ginger, 2 drops Orange, 5 drops Peppermint and top with Fractionated Coconut oil. 

For immune support you can also try this great essential oil blend in a 5ml bottle.  Add 2 drops Cinnamon, 2 drops Clove, 3 drops Lemon, 3 drops Tea Tree, 2 drops Oregano, 3 drops Rosemary and top with Fractionated Coconut Oil.

Love these blends and want them in a 10 ml roller bottle?  Simply double the drops of each oil and with top fractionated coconut oil. 

No bottles?  No problem!  We have all the bottles you need right HERE.  No oils?  Well that’s not a problem either!! We have oils too right HERE.  We also love love love to teach about oils too.  Contact us anytime and we will help you out!

entry.title: How To Avoid Lice
entry.content:
School Ski Trip....200 kids trying on helmets...noooo!
Our school ski trip was yesterday and we had an amazing day. All three of my kids love going. This was my 6 year old's second time skiing and he rocked it....besides going on the chair lift with Mom and Dad and not getting off at the end and having to be lifted down....I guess he didn't realize that when we told him 10 times on the way up the lift that he would have to stand up and get off, that he would actually have to stand up and get off!! This only happened once of course because after that my husband and I made sure we had his arm to drag him off with us.

But this is email is not about 2 parents getting off the ski lift while their six year old stayed on, it's about how you can take preventative measures to ward off lice when 200 kids are trying on helmets!

The first thing I did was mix up some Lice Be Gone Spray the night before.

Lice Be Gone

8 drops lemongrass essential oil
5 drops geranium essential oil
5 drops peppermint essential oil
5 drops tea tree essential oil
2 drops clove essential oil
Mix in a 15 ml glass bottle and top up with distilled water. 

This can be mixed in our 15ml lotion pump bottles or a 15ml spray bottle (we are working on sourcing spray bottles to add to our store right now!) Shake well and pump one to two pumps in your hands, rub together and run through your child's hair to deter lice.

Preventative tips to avoid getting lice on your school ski trip;

  1. Put a little Lice Be Gone in your child's hair and on their shoulders the morning of.
  2. When trying on multiple helmets make sure you have a toque on! If its too warm for a toque add some extra Lice Be Gone to their hair and cross your fingers and toes!!
  3. After you hand in your helmet do NOT stuff the toque back in the bag with the rest of the jackets and toques but place it in a plastic bag and tie shut. Either wash it when you get home or leave it in the bag for 48 hours. You can also toss the bag in the freezer overnight!
  4. Check through your child's hair, just to be sure. A quick check takes less time then having to treat them and wash all the bedding in your house!!
Shop Now

Make sure to save this picture of our Lice Be Gone recipe! You can put a little in your kids hair every morning before school as well!
Don't have the oils you need?  Find them here. 

Do you have any tips on how to avoid lice? Or maybe some parenting tips so I don't leave my 6 year old on the chair lift again?? 

My Essential Life

entry.title: No Nonsense— What it means to be a small business owner
entry.summary:
What does success mean to you? Do you define success in dollar amounts or in how happy you are??

More
entry.content:
No Nonsense— What it means to be a small business owner

When people ask me what I do for a living my answers are always the same, “my husband I farm and I have a hair salon in my house….oh….and I am co-owner of an online store.” Why do I answer like this? I’m not ashamed of our store, but I always feel that I’m being measured by how “successful” the store is.

Our store, My Essential Life, has been up and running for just over a year now. Is it successful, you ask? Define success — “the fact of getting or achieving wealth respect or fame” (Websters dictionary)

If I have to define success by Websters definition, which many people do, then I guess I would have to say no our business is not successful. But maybe, I should check out different definitions of success. The late Zig Ziglar, argued that “True success has more components than one sentence or idea can contain.” So let’s redefine success!

Success —
 believing you can; 
always doing your best; 
overcoming your fears;
learning something new everyday;
“If you can dream it you can achieve it;”
 “You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.”

With definitions like that then yes our business is very successful! It’s hard though to keep these new definitions of success in mind when people question you on “how the store is doing” because my first thought always flies back to the Webster definition. Oh yeah, they want to know how much profit we are making and I instantly get defensive. I’m only defensive in my mind though!

What needs to be done? “Success must never be measured by how much money you have.” Stop believing that success is measured in wealth and start believing that success stems from believing in yourself and in what you stand for.

What do you do for a living? — “I’m co-owner of My Essential Life, an online store specializing in essential oil accessories and supplies.”

Oh yeah? How’s that going for you? — “It’s going great, we are now in the top 14% of all other Shopify stores that opened the same time as us! I’m so excited for how the store is growing and can’t wait to see what this year brings for us!”

Changing that one response and thinking positively are going to make such a difference and I encourage you to think the same way! Don’t measure your success in dollars, “it’s not what you’ve got but what you use that makes a difference.”

entry.title: No Nonsense Hacks for Moms
entry.content:
As a mom, I know we need organization and efficiency...and I also know what we get is chaos and frantic rushing out the door!  Wouldn’t it be awesome if you were prepared and had some control right at your finger tips??  Well, I’m here to let you know that is right within your grasp!

We all want to keep our kids healthy, and I love to do that with Essential Oils.  My house has oils all over...belly blend in the kitchen, stuffy nose blend in Elle’s room, Cedar wood on Sophia’s dresser, InTune on Nick’s desk, and definitely Vetiver on my nightstand.  Chaos right??  NO MORE!  I’m taking a stand!

Carrying Cases to the rescue!  I’m going to grab a case and throw in all the necessities.  No more running around in the middle of the night looking for Breathe because all the oils are in the same spot!!

If I can organize my oils at home, why not on the go too?!! I can throw a smaller case in my purse.  All the oils I need on the go are right at my finger tips!  No more searching to the bottom deep depths of my purse in search of the belly blend, when I look in the rear-view mirror and see my kids are green with car sickness.   

As I sit back feeling pretty proud of my brilliance in organizational skills, I think I need to reward myself. I know! I need an aromatherapy necklace to throw my favourite blend on.  Calm mom, calm kids right!?  I need something to hold it together all day long!  For the kids sake!

We have everything you need right HERE to make your life a little easier.

entry.title: Lost Your Happy Heart? Get it Back Now!!
entry.content:
February is supposed to be the happy heart month....but not everyone feels this way. 

 As a Social Worker I am tasked with the care of heavy hearts every day.  Sometimes we....and I mean all of us when I say we....can bring ourselves down with our negative thinking patterns. 

Ever get caught up in the old song playing in your head? Those nasty lyrics belting out the tune...”I’m not good enough, I’ll never be enough, I can’t handle it, and I’m such a failure”...nasty nasty thoughts! 

Hey, we have all been there...if you say you haven’t had those thought pop into your beautiful heads....I’m gonna call you on that fib!!

Well I’m here to tell you that you have the power and control to challenge those negative patterns and create more realistic and positive thoughts!  

Change your tune...rewrite your lyrics.  Instead of....."I can’t handle it", sing...."it’s tough right now but if I do one thing at a time I will get it all done"...  Or instead of "I’m a failure"....sing a note of “I’m not perfect and I don’t need to be, I’m only human after all.”  Now doesn’t that feel better???   

On my journey of learning how to challenge thinking patterns I have some beautiful essential oils with me. My favourites are Doterra’ s Balance and Forgive blends.  Balance, to me feels like a stroll in the forest with its sweet notes of Ho Wood, Frankincense, Blue Tansy and Blue Chamomile.  Forgive, is another must for me with the beautiful fragrances of Spruce, Bergamot, Juniper Berry, Myrrh, Arborvitae, Nootka, Thyme and Citronella to set my heart on the right path. 

So in February and for the rest of the year find balance in your thinking, forgive yourself and take back your happy heart!! 

- Your Prairie Girl, 

Erin

We would love to hear from you!  Send us an email and tell us how you keep yourself going! Find us HERE

entry.title: Do you want to spice it up this Valentine's Day?
entry.content:
Need a little spice this Valentine's Day? - or maybe you want to throw a little water on that fire!?

Well the majority of us are looking for the spice, cuz lets face it, spicy is always better than bland. 

What is your Valentine's Day consist of? Mine - well I'm gonna enjoy my cup of coffee from 6-7 and then get my kids up for school. I have a salon in my house so I am booked with a color in the morning - next off to school where I will be volunteering to supervise for the Teachers because....hey did you know it's teacher appreciation week! Then back home to do a few more haircuts before kids get home from school. Once my kids step off the bus I have 7 mins to get them into the car and leave for gymnastics - get home from gym at 8:45!

Now where is there time in the day for spicy thoughts! if you've had a long day and you need to spice it up this Valentines Day here is a list of essential oils which are natural aphrodisiacs.

Aphrodisiac Essential Oils

  • Ylang Ylang Essential Oil
  • Neroli Essential Oil
  • Clary Sage Essential Oil
  • Jasmine Essential Oil
  • Sweet Fennel Essential Oil
  • Rose Essential Oil

What if your day has been to long?? Maybe you want to save those spicy oils for tomorrow night and use an aphrodisi-don't! 

Aphrodisi-don't Essential Oils

  • Marjoram Essential Oil

So some may decide to put a couple dabs of Jasmine Essential Oil on their wrists and neck and others may choose to slather themselves in Marjoram Essential Oil! 

Here's a "spicy" blend you can mix up in a 5ml Rollerbottle.

Spice It Up

- 2 drops Jasmine Essential Oil

-2 drops Wild Orange Essential Oil

-2 drops Sandalwood Essential Oil

- 1 drop Ylang Ylang Essential Oil

-Mix together in a 5ml Rollerbottle and top up with a carrier oil. Apply to your wrists, neck and temples.

 

 

"Spicy" or "Bland" have an awesome day no matter how you choose to celebrate!

Your My Essential Life Team

entry.title: Recharge This January with Essential Oil Blends
entry.content:
January - Refresh Recharge Renew with Essential Oil Blends

Is anyone else feeling a little lost this January?? I sure am! It seems like I still have a million things to finish up from last year, and now I have a million things to start for this year! It makes my head spin!

Last week was a crazy week, so many tasks to complete and not knowing which one should take priority!

  • Should I finish this up?
  • Maybe I should start on that?
  • No, I need to make this quick phone call first?
  • Write a blog??
  • Ugh whatever I'm not getting anything accomplished anyway so I might as well fold laundry!

I was feeling a tad bit overwhelmed until we met with the beautiful Heather Pinay of Authentically , who by the way people is freaken AMAZING, to map out our marketing plan for 2018. Not only did she help map out our goals and marketing for 2018 but she also mapped out a schedule for me right down to when I should throw a load of laundry in! 

My feet feel firmly planted on the ground and I'm ready to tackle all my tasks! The key to planning tasks is to write a list of what you want to accomplish and block out time to get it done - that and a little help from my friends!

First things first, I need a little focus. Out come my essential oils to mix myself up such a focus blend!

My Essential Life Focus Blend:

  • Peppermint Essential Oil (20 drops)
  • Wild Orange Essential Oil (20 drops)
  • Frankincense Essential Oil (10 drops)

 

 

Save or pin this image for later!

 

Mix this blend up in our pretty Frosted Blue Rollerbottles and you will have my favorite Focus Blend. Apply to your wrists, neck and temples throughout the day to keep you focused on the task at hand! CAUTION - Do NOT roll on your temples before you workout - sweat, eyes, burning...you get the picture! Have squirley kids? Make a second blend to pack in their backpacks. Our rollerbottles come in six packs - so you can mix up your favorites for everyone and be on a roll.

Whether your head is spinning or not, writing lists and making achievable goals topped with the support of essential oils will help you get more done as you wrap up the busy month of January. While we are at it, we want to know if you have any tips for us on how you stay focused - with essential oil recipes or practical tips and tricks!

    

       - Angela
